newsitem.title: UK: British mergers hit record level.
newsitem.headline: British mergers hit record level.

text.p: Mergers and acquisitions activity in Britain reached record levels in the first half of 1997, according to figures released Monday by the magazine Acquisitions Monthly.

"Public bids announced in the first half of 1997 were at their highest value ever, at 22.3 billion pounds ($38 billion). The previous record of 21 billion ($35.5 billion) was set in the first half of 1989," it said.
British investment banking group Schroders topped the mergers and acquisitions advisory league table, with a total of 17 public and private deals worth a total of 5.81 billion pounds ($9.8 billion).
Baring Brothers, the corporate finance wing of Dutch-owned ING Barings, which enjoyed the number one position in 1995 and 1996, is second so far this year.
